{"step_by_step_thinking": "Nolla's stages of tooth development are a system used to measure the progress of tooth formation. Stage 1 represents the beginning of calcification at the sites of future cusps. Stage 2 represents the fusion of calcified points to form a continuous calcified cap on the superior portion of the dental papilla, which is the initial calcification of the crown.", "answer_choice": "B. Stage 2"}
